channel.title: 📚 Technical Reference on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in 📚 Technical Reference on Analyst

item.title: 💫 System Supernova
item.description: One of the main things to know when performing forensic analysis is knowing what’s normal and what’s not. It would take ages to google every single pinch of this information, that’s why I have decided to make a clean install of several systems and capture their state to have an idea what’s good for each of them.

item.title: Firewalls 🔥
item.description: Firewalls monitor access from the outside network to the inside network. Traffic originating from inside the network would not pass through the firewall.???

item.title: IDS And IPS ✋
item.description: Host-based IDS look for local system configurations and behaviour, while network-based IDS look for network connections and looks for anomalies and common signatures.

item.title: 👣 Persistence Mechanisms Reference
item.description: Windows Services 🔑 HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services. The executable needs to have certain code and permissions for service behaviour and there are three options to acomplish that:

item.title: 📚 Mail Analysis Reference
item.description: Protocols. SMTP (Simple Mail Transport Protocol) and extended SMTP are used for outbound mailbox📤 and POP3/IMAP - for inbound 📥.

item.title: 📚 RAM Tools Reference
item.description: Volatility # install brew packet manager ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)" < /dev/null 2> /dev/null # install volatility (python should be installed) brew install volatile # vol.

item.title: 📚 YARA Reference
item.description: Yara: brew install yara pip install yara-python Repo for malware and forensics. YaraGen.

item.title: Defence Mechanisms ⚔️
item.description: Attackers need to collect information about the target system first: ping, nmap. Countermeasures: record traffic look for suspicious activity use a host scanner and keep track of all the PCs withing your network.

item.title: File Systems
item.description: File Systems Overview Name Partition size (min/max) Cluster size (min/max) File Max Size fstab code FAT16 16Mb/2Gb 2Kb/32Kb FAT32 260Mb/32Gb 🔍 2Kb/32Kb NTFS 1.

item.title: Partition Schemas
item.description: Bootcode and Booting Process Partition tables Partitioning is the address range where the volume with a file system can sit.

item.title: Flash Memory Overview
item.description: In this article I’m going to give a general overview of how SSD works and how it’s different from an HDD.

item.title: HDD Overview
item.description: In this article I’m going to give a general overview of how HDDs work. Floppy Floppy disks 💾 are like dinosaurs 🦕.

item.title: 📚 Cloud Reference
item.description: Virtualization vs Cloud Cloud computing is the on-demand availability of resources. PROS CONS flexibility, agility and choices Security?
